definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: Though the flower dies if plucked.
Flowers will fade, grass will wither, but love endures.
sentences.chinese: 花会凋谢，草会干黄，惟有爱是永不衰残。

sentences.english: Dating costs a lot of money, laying a huge financial burden on families.
sentences.chinese: 谈恋爱花会花很多钱，给家庭带来经济负担。

sentences.english: Folk Hua-hui is the special living space in the folk sports.
sentences.chinese: 民间花会是民间体育特殊的生存空间。

sentences.english: Flower fade and fruit of summer fade.
sentences.chinese: 花会凋谢，盛夏的果实会枯萎。

sentences.english: She knew Lee was a threat.
sentences.chinese: 她知道李相花会对她产生威胁。

sentences.english: These blossoms produce cranberry-sized coffee cherries.
sentences.chinese: 这些花会结出越桔状的咖啡果。

sentences.english: This has greatly influenced the folk sports' survival and development.
sentences.chinese: 极大地影响了花会中民间体育的生存与发展。

sentences.english: We're hoping the flowers will bloom this spring and make the school look beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望今年春天这些花会开，把学校装点得更美丽。

definition: Birthday of the Flowers, spring festival on lunar 12th or 15th February
the queen of flowers (refers esp. to plum blossom)/(fig.) nickname for a famous beauty or courtesan
the Lantern Festival (15th of first month of lunar calendar)
narcissus/daffodil/legendary aquatic immortal/refers to those buried at sea/person who wanders abroad and does not return
style of folk song popular in Gansu, Qinghai and Ningxia/CL:首[shou3]
colored lantern (used at Lantern Festival 元宵節|元宵节)
to pick flowers/to enter houses at night in order to rape women
